intro: Microlicia recurva, commonly known as the slender microlicia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or white, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Microlicia recurva is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands.
